author: Francis
title: 5 awesome gadgets you probably never knew existed | Deccan Chronicle
text:
Francis D'Sa | October 19, 2015, 11.24 am Technology is evolving each day and helping make our lives easier every moment. From printing in 3D to fun flying objects, there is one for everyone out there. While some are already here, there are many still in development mode others are in prototypes and some in design stages. Let’s check five such gadgets that can help you with work and fun in everyday life.
Tiku 3D: This is a unique, simple and highly portable 3D printer yet. 15.4-inches in height, this 3D desktop printer can help you print your imagination into the real world to create objects and designs that would have required expensive molding and production machines. Priced just below $180, this printer can help you print object in 3D, right on your desk.
Avegant Glyph: a cyborg will be a thing of the past. Soon, we would be able to just buy a simple powerful gadget which can convert itself into a 3D vision goggles from being a simple pair of headphones. The headband doubles as a display screen, which can be placed in front of your eyes to watch a full 3D movie, unless you just need it to work as an audio device. It does not feature an actual display, but uses a simple technology found in conventional projectors. The light is reflected from an LED source off a few million mirrors and directly onto the retina of your eye to produce the image.
PowerUp 3.0: Unleash your child instincts with PowerUp, the simple, powerful and unique smartphone-controlled paper plane. This is a simple gadget with a Bluetooth-controlled cockpit and a powerful propeller that can be attached to any simple paper-folded airplane that you used to make in your childhood days. Gone are the days where you would run and throw that folded paper plane and watch it simply glide for a few seconds and fall to the ground. Now you can attach this simple PowerUp gadget to that very plane you just folded and enjoy flying it with your smartphone. The new ones are also available with a tiny camera for live streaming.
Bubl: The 360-degree camera for your video conferencing and CCTV cameras, Bubl is a simple 260g globe with four high-def cameras onboard. While one is on the top, the other three are around it and all four merge their videos using a powerful onboard processor to create a 360-degree video. The Bublcam is wireless and is a great new futuristic camera that will transform the way we do video conferencing today. Watch it in action below. What’s more? This camera’s output video can be clubbed with your virtual reality goggles and you can also enjoy 360-degree VR video home videos and video conference chats too. So go out and book your very own 360-degree video camera.
